edu.isr.data

Class Fold

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.isr.data.Fold

  • public class Fold
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a set of instances. Each dataset may be represent by one or more folds.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Fold

        Fold(java.lang.String foldName)
        Create an empty Fold.
        Parameters:
        foldName - Full name of the folder, including its index and extension.

    • Method Detail

      • normalizeData

        public void normalizeData()
        Normalize all the attributes to similar ranges in order to ensure that no unadapted data ranges bias the weights.

      • assignRanks

        public void assignRanks(ParametersManager params)
                 throws java.io.IOException
        Assign ranks to the instances in the fold. The position of each instance in the ranking depends on its weight, which are assigned and updated to it during the iterations of the procedure.
        Parameters:
        params - Experiment parameters.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - If some error occurs while creating the file containing the weights.

      • measureDistBetweenInst

        private void measureDistBetweenInst(java.lang.String distMetric)
        Measure the distance between each pair of instances.
        Parameters:
        distMetric - Metric used in order to calculate distances between instances.

      • weighInstances

        private void weighInstances(ParametersManager params)
        Weigh the entire fold.
        Parameters:
        params - Experiment parameters.

      • weighInstance

        private void weighInstance(Instance inst,
                           ParametersManager params,
                           com.google.common.collect.TreeMultimap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Integer> sortedDistances)
        Weigh an specific instance.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be weighted.
        params - Experiment parameters.
        sortedDistances - Map containing, for the current instance, the distance to the other instances and the id corresponding to each one of them. The entries are sorted by their distance value (and duplicates are allowed).

      • findNeighbors

        private void findNeighbors(int instId,
                           int numNeighbors,
                           com.google.common.collect.TreeMultimap<java.lang.Double,java.lang.Integer> sortedDistances)
        Finds the set of neighbors of an instance and registers their distances.
        Parameters:
        instId - Id of the instance for which we want to find the neighbors.
        numNeighbors - Number of instances taken as neighbors.
        sortedDistances - Map containing, for the current instance, the distance to the other instances and the id corresponding to each one of them. The entries are sorted by their distance value (and duplicates are allowed).

      • addInst

        void addInst(Instance inst)
        Add a new instance to the fold.
        Parameters:
        inst - The instance to be added.

      • setNumInst

        void setNumInst(int numInst)
        Set the total number of instances.
        Parameters:
        numInst - The number of instances.

      • setNumAttr

        void setNumAttr(int numAttr)
        Set the number of attributes (input + output) of the instances (any of them).
        Parameters:
        numAttr - The number of attributes.
